param.name: dataframe
param.label: Data frame
param.help: File name to save the raw R dataframe emitted by CBS or Fused Lasso. (Useful for debugging.)

param.name: method
param.label: Segmentation method
param.option: a pure-Python implementation of HaarSeg, a wavelet-based method. Very fast and performs reasonably well on small panels, but tends to over-segment large datasets., hybrid (haar)
simply calculate the weighted mean log2 value of each chromosome arm. Useful for testing or debugging, or as a baseline for benchmarking other methods., hybrid (none)

(experimental) – a 3-state Hidden Markov Model suitable for most samples. Faster than CBS, and slower but more accurate than Haar. Requires the Python package pomegranate, as do the next two methods., hybrid (hmm)

(experimental) – a 5-state HMM suitable for finer-grained segmentation of good-quality tumor samples. In particular, this method can detect focal amplifications within a larger-scale, smaller-amplitude copy number gain, or focal deep deletions within a larger-scale hemizygous loss. Training this model takes a bit more CPU time than the simpler hmm method., hybrid (hmm-tumor)

(experimental) – a 3-state HMM with fixed amplitude for the loss, neutral, and gain states corresponding to absolute copy numbers of 1, 2, and 3. Suitable for germline samples and single-cell sequencing of samples with mostly-diploid genomes that are not overly aneuploid., hybrid (hmm-germline)

param.name: threshold
param.label: Significance threshold
param.help: To accept breakpoints during segmentation. For HMM methods, this is the smoothing window size.

param.name: drop_low_coverage
param.label: Drop very-low-coverage bins before segmentation
param.help: To avoid false-positive deletions in poor-quality tumor samples

param.name: drop_outliers
param.label: Drop outlier
param.help: Drop outlier bins more than this many multiples of the 95th quantile away from the average within a rolling window. Set to 0 for no outlier filtering.

param.name: smooth_cbs
param.label: Perform an additional smoothing before CBS segmentations

param.name: vcf
param.label: VCF file
param.help: VCF file name containing variants for calculation of b-allele frequencies.

param.name: sample_id
param.label: Name of the sample in the VCF to use for b-allele frequency extraction.

param.name: normal_id
param.label: Corresponding normal sample ID in the input VCF
param.help: This sample is used to select only germline SNVs to calculate b-allele frequencies.

param.name: min_variant_depth
param.label: Minimum read depth for a SNV
param.help: To be used in the b-allele frequency calculation.

param.name: zygosity_freq
param.label: Ignore VCF's genotypes and instead infer zygosity from allele frequencies.
